pros: Decent pay, lots of friendly staff.
cons: However, that doesn't make up for lots of passive-aggressive, toxic, abusive, incompetent, and unprofessional staff (in various departments). The hands-off, absent management really has no idea what's going on on a daily basis; I'm baffled as to how many of them got their jobs. Training is insufficient and inconsistent. As a result of all of the above, patient care and safety is at risk. As well, part-time staff have woefully insufficient and inconsistent hours.

pros: higher than average pay, nice people, nice area
cons: over worked, stressful, not paid enough

pros: Great work culture and hours.
cons: The hourly rate is lower than other hospitals

review_title: This place does not respect its employees or patients
pros: None. I used to like this place. It’s all about the money now.
cons: It is obvious, by the little games that staff play, that this place does not respect their patients. It’s a hospital not a reality show.

pros: I work with good people
cons: Management here changes a lot

review_title: Great community sensibility but overall not recommended
pros: Great community sensibility, staff is welcoming and friendly. New building is spacious and high tech. Computer systems newly implemented are modern and innovative.
cons: Major staffing and management issues. High nursing burn out rate. Due to low income area, emergency is always packed. Building is due for many renovations and upgrades. Overall, good experience but highly do not recommend for personal long term satisfaction. Difficult to transfer between units because all units require 6mo-1year specialized certification on your own time and money. Very very difficult to navigate around the hospital - patients and family members are constantly lost, as there are not enough maps and signage to clearly outline main directions.

pros:
Lots of Hours, easy work, customer service, happy co-workers, and lots work to go around to everyone. 
Shifts are 7am-3, 3 - 11pm so you can have a good life-work balance
cons:
tough management, lots of union troubles : some people have been there for too long, and refuse to do any additional tasks that are put in front of them.

Hospitals are not for the faint of heart, we see a lot of horrible stuff that can not be forgotten.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Toronto, ON
pros: Workers are supportive , friendly environment but depends on the unit you will work.
cons: If you are a great worker and hate politics you may not want to pick this hospital.I have a colleague of mine  worked  in this place that treated badly  by the management. I heard lots of stories how they treated the staff but because of confidentiality nobody want to speak up.This place does not provide good benefits they picked the cheapest extended health benefits.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Toronto, ON
pros: amazing co-workers with impeccable team work especially in a stressful environment
cons: Senior leadership team fails to provide open communication with the team. They do not value the opinions and advice of their employees. As health care is run as a business the bottom dollar is more important than patient and staff member safety

pros: People are nice and friendly. Helpful once you get to know them
cons: Lots of meetings, need to chase people for info, people don't read emails. Disorganized, little accountability, and very political

pros: Well supported, educated, motivated staff and management. Signs of a culture of inclusiveness and passion for patient care are evident everywhere. Wonderful cafeteria too, free wifi, affordable gym.
cons: Aging infrastructure, pay parking, some early signs of decreasing support and autonomy for staff by management.

pros: Best manager I have ever had that was really looking out for employee's future. Was aware of low hours as part-timer and was suggesting opportunities in other departments. Very accommodating of personal time such as school or other jobs.
cons:
Varying hours
Not enough hours as part-time
Somewhat stressful hospital environment

pros: walking distance from my dveling
cons: Inadequate training: outdated training manual,  training staff doesn't show up to train new employee,  training staff shops online instead of providing a training,  management is abusive behind closed doors one  on one and discriminates. My advice bring a tape recorder first day, have it on during all your shifts, and record everything!
